name: Artbreeder

score_rationale.persistence: Launched 2018 as Ganbreeder, rebranded to Artbreeder. 7+ years operation. Continuous tool additions (Composer, Collager, Mixer, Poser).
score_rationale.autonomy: Users direct image breeding/mixing. Platform provides GAN infrastructure but no autonomous creation. Community-directed evolution.
score_rationale.cultural_impact: Pioneer of collaborative AI art. Predates Midjourney/DALL-E. Influential on generative art community. Less mainstream visibility than later services.
score_rationale.economic_reality: Freemium model with subscriptions. Small team (Morphogen collective). Sustainable but not high-growth.
score_rationale.governance: Community contributes to shared image database. All images publicly remixable by default. Proto-commons model.
score_rationale.tech_distinctiveness: Unique 'breeding' metaphor: images have genes, can be crossbred. StyleGAN + BigGAN infrastructure. Iterative evolutionary approach vs one-shot generation.
score_rationale.narrative_coherence: Clear 'collaborative breeding' concept. Biological evolution metaphor consistent throughout. Distinct identity from prompt-based generators.

curator_notes: Artbreeder pioneered the collaborative approach to AI art generation. Founded by Joël Simon (Morphogen collective) in 2018 as Ganbreeder, it predates the DALL-E/Midjourney wave by years. The platform's unique 'breeding' metaphor treats images as organisms with genes (slider parameters) that can be crossbred with any public image. This creates evolutionary, community-driven image creation rather than prompt-response generation. While less commercially successful than later services, Artbreeder's influence on generative art methodology—iterative, collaborative, evolutionary—remains significant. Recent updates integrate SD-XL and ControlNet.

evidence.claim: Unique breeding/crossbreeding metaphor with gene sliders
Pioneer of collaborative AI art, predates Midjourney/DALL-E
